content: pattern information this sweater features an oversized fit for the body contrasting with the glove-like fit of the sleeves particularly close-fitting to knit this jumper start with the modular construction of the yoke following the pattern from triangle a1 to triangle i104 to make the process easier the triangles have been divided into 9 types marked from a to i each triangle is explained separately next work the neckline by picking up stitches around the neck opening then pick up stitches along the bottom edge of the yoke and work the body in the round from the top down the sleeves are worked separately in the round from the top down measurements width 46 50-54-62-69-73-78-83-87-91 cm/ 18 19 5-21 25-24 5-27-28 75-30 75-32 5-34 25-35 75 length 44 46-48-50-52-54-56-58-60-62 cm / 17 25 18-19-19 5-20 5-25 25-22-22 75-23 524 5 arm circumference 25 28-30-30-33-38-40-40-43-45 cm / 10 11-11 25-11 25-13-15-16-16-17-18 materials merino care 1 skein of each of the following colors color 2 color 3 color 4 color 5 color 7 color 8 color 9 color 11 color 15 color 16 color 17 color 18 color 19 color 20 color 21 color 23 color 24 color 25 color 27 color 29 6 6 7 7 7 8 9 11 12 13 skeins of color 13 circular needle 4 mm 80/100 cm / us 7 32/40 circular needle 3 75 mm 40/80cm / us 5 16/32 double-pointed needles dpns 4 mm/us7 tapestry needle
